questions.question: IoT stands for ………………………
questions.explanation: IoT stands for Internet of Things, referring to a network of connected devices that collect and exchange data.

questions.question: Which of the following technologies have unified and has resulted in the evolution of IoT?
questions.explanation: Technologies like low-power embedded systems, cloud computing, and machine learning have unified to enable IoT.

questions.question: Which of the following are the enablers of IoT?
questions.explanation: RFID, sensors, and nanotechnology are key enablers of IoT, enabling connectivity and data exchange.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of an IoT LAN?
questions.explanation: IoT LANs handle local communication; global or worldwide connections are managed by WAN or Internet layers.

questions.question: The integration of existing devices, smart devices, and constrained nodes in a singular framework is one of the reasons for the address crunch in IoT.
questions.explanation: Integration of multiple devices increases the need for unique IP addresses, leading to address exhaustion.

questions.question: In Multi-homing, a node/network is connected to a single network for improved reliability.
questions.explanation: Multi-homing involves connecting a node or network to multiple networks for redundancy and reliability.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are the approach/approaches for multi-homing?
questions.explanation: Both proxy-based and gateway-based approaches are used for implementing multi-homing in IoT systems.

questions.question: IPv6 uses ………………………….. notation for its representation.
questions.explanation: IPv6 addresses are represented in hexadecimal notation, allowing compact representation of 128-bit addresses.

questions.question: The parameters sensed by a sensor may be sent to the cloud for further processing.
questions.explanation: IoT devices often send sensed data to the cloud for storage, analytics, and further decision-making.

questions.question: The IPv6 notation uses ………………………… number of bits to represent an address.
questions.explanation: IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long, providing a vastly larger address space than IPv4.

questions.question: A sensor is -
options: Only sensitive to the measured property
Insensitive to any other property that what the sensor is made to sense
questions.explanation: Sensors are designed to detect specific properties while being insensitive to others.

questions.question: We classify sensors based on -
questions.explanation: Sensors can be classified based on their output type (analog or digital) and the data type they handle.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct statement?
options: Controlling AC loads using low DC signals
questions.explanation: All the statements are correct; relays are electromechanical devices used to control AC loads using DC signals.

questions.question: Based on the output, sensors are classified as ……………………
questions.explanation: Sensors can output analog or digital signals depending on their design and application.

questions.question: Soft actuators are -
questions.explanation: Soft actuators are made from polymer materials that deform under external stimuli to produce motion.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are not a thing as per IoT?
questions.explanation: All listed items can be IoT-enabled when connected and controlled via the internet.

questions.question: The things in IoT consist of embedded systems.
questions.explanation: IoT devices rely on embedded systems with sensors, processors, and actuators for operation.

questions.question: IoT is one of the technologies that enable smart farms.
questions.explanation: IoT enables smart farming through connected sensors and devices for real-time agricultural monitoring.

questions.question: In M2M, it is mandatory that the interactions between the machines and devices happen through a cloud computing infrastructure.
questions.explanation: M2M devices can communicate directly without requiring cloud infrastructure, though it can be used optionally.

questions.question: Sometimes, when there is a need for the nodes to communicate directly to the Internet, ………………………….. can be used.
questions.explanation: Tunneling allows IoT nodes to securely establish direct communication with the Internet.

questions.question: In multi-homing a node/network is connected to only two networks for improved reliability.
questions.explanation: Multi-homing connects a node to two or more networks, not just two, to improve reliability.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are not enablers of IoT?
questions.explanation: Gene sequencing is related to biology, not IoT; enablers include sensors, RFID, and nanotechnology.

questions.question: The decreasing number of devices in IoT is expected to result in an address crunch.
questions.explanation: An address crunch occurs due to an increasing, not decreasing, number of IoT devices.

questions.question: Why IoT has become so popular?
options: It can provide advanced level of services to the society
It can help reduce human effort
It can potentially make processes more efficient
questions.explanation: IoT provides advanced services, reduces human effort, and improves efficiency across various domains.

questions.question: The resolution of a sensor is the maximum change it can detect in the quantity that it is measuring.
questions.explanation: Resolution refers to the minimum change a sensor can detect; maximum change defines its range.

questions.question: Transducer is a …………term and includes………
questions.explanation: A transducer converts one form of energy into another and includes both sensors and actuators.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are feature/features of sensors?
options: It is only sensitive to the measured property.
It acts on the surrounding environment.
questions.answer: It is only sensitive to the measured property.
questions.explanation: Sensors should respond only to the specific property they measure; acting on the environment is for actuators.

questions.question: Which of the following technologies have unified and has resulted in the evolution of IoT?
questions.explanation: IoT evolved through the combination of low-power embedded systems, cloud computing, and machine learning.

questions.question: What is the full form of IoT?
questions.explanation: IoT stands for Internet of Things, a network of connected physical devices exchanging data.

questions.question: A sensor node is not made up of which of the following?
questions.explanation: A sensor node includes sensors, a processing unit, and a power source — all listed components are correct.
